content.full_text:
Petition of Bowling Green and Others to the Sangamon County Commissioners’ Court,
               4 February 18331
paragraphs:
Petition of Bowling Green and Others to the Sangamon County Commissioners’ Court,
               4 February 18331
citations:
Minutes for 7 March 1833, Sangamon County Commissioners Court, Record Book D, Manuscripts
                     Division, Abraham Lincoln Presidential Library and Museum, Springfield IL.

footnotes.text:
1Bowling Green authored this petition. Abraham Lincoln signed his own name.This particular petition may or may not have been presented to the Sangamon County
                  Commissioners’ Court. On March 7, 1833, a petition very similar to this one was presented
                  to them; in response, the court appointed Hugh Armstrong, James Watkins, and the county
                  surveyor to view and locate the road. This petition bears docketing indicating Hugh
                  Armstrong, William Green, and James Goldsby were appointed to survey the road.Minutes for 7 March 1833, Sangamon County Commissioners Court, Record Book D, Manuscripts
                     Division, Abraham Lincoln Presidential Library and Museum, Springfield IL.
